moves.1. e4: A game dominated by white but lost due to 2 blunders... Shows that even if the enemy has made a thousand mistakes and it seems it is impossible to lose, a stupid mistake can cost you the game...
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Bc5 3. Nxe5 Qe7 4. d4 Bb4: 2 Black mistakes have costed him 2 pawns, together with limited development. White seems in a nice position.
moves.7... Nf6 8. Qd3 a5 9. O-O b6 10. Bxf7+: One more pawn, white's job seems easy...
moves.10... Kf8 11. Bd5 d6: Another black's blunder, this time much more costly
moves.12. Nc6 Qc7 13. Nxb4 axb4 14. Bxa8 bxc3: So, white has already clear material advantage....
moves.18... Kg8 19. Qxb8 Qh5: Hoping to create some game against the white king...
moves.20. Qxc8+ Kf7 21. h3: ??? Unbelievable blunder by white, destroys whatever he has been building from the beginning...
moves.21... Rxc8 22. Bd5+ Kf8 23. hxg4 Qxg4: White still has some nice game though....
moves.24. c3 Qe2 25. Rab1 h5 26. a3 h4 27. Bg5: strong move, getting many problems to the white king....
moves.31. g4 Rh8 32. Bf4 Qh7 33. Bh2 Qc2 34. R: ?????? This second blunder costs a whole game....
